item.title: Drop percentages
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Also, because int’s round down when dividing, you can use the mod operator to be more specific when making, say, a calculator.

You could do something like: System.out.println("Dividing 22 by 7:"); System.out.println("22/7 equals " + (22/7) + " with a remainder of " + 22%7);

The output would be:Dividing 22 by 7: 22/7 equals 3 with a remainder of 1

Now to fix your problem. To do this I would add another array that had the percentages in them and then add a random that checks the percentages.

Read full topic

item.title: Drop percentages
item.dc:creator: @99range_k0 99range k0
item.description:
@99range_k0 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:12, topic:337673”][quote author=99range k0 link=topic=434075.msg3187332#msg3187332 date=1271888596]
I still don’t quite follow. Gimme an example or somethin?
[/quote]If you have ever heard of mod in math or remainders, it’s the same thing.

Basically if you do something like int modzero = 10%2; the number would be 0 because 10/2 has a remainder of 0.
However,int modzero = 11%2; would be 1 because 11/2 has a remainder of 1.[/quote]

I see…how would I put this in the code? And btw, do you kno how to make npcs aggressive?

item.title: Drop percentages
item.dc:creator: @99range_k0 99range k0
item.description:
@99range_k0 wrote:

Idk why, I have tried it and everything, but when I go to check drops well yea… drops just don’t work.
I found out how to do the percentage thing. However many numbers are in front of it, is the chance.
Example if theres 3000 numbers in front of it, it has a 1/3000 drop rate.

public static int Flambeed[] = { 17001, 17001, 17001,(keep repeating 17001), 17014}; public static int randomFlambeed() { return Flambeed[(int) (Math.random() * Flambeed.length)]; }

And actually vesta, I DO KNOW HOW TO USE NPCDROPS.CFG! IT SIMPLY WON"T WORK, THATS JUST NOT HOW DROPS WORK ON SERVER!

Read full topic

item.title: Drop percentages
item.dc:creator: @VestaPK VestaPK
item.description:
@VestaPK wrote:

Replace line 1 with this;

public static int Flambeed[] = { 17001, 7014, 1, 100 }

or

public static int Flambeed[] = { 17001, 1, 7014, 100 }

If they don’t work I don’t know as I have never used this solution.

Read full topic

item.title: Drop percentages
item.dc:creator: @99range_k0 99range k0
item.description:
@99range_k0 wrote:

How will I make it where in item2(i put drops there) one of the items has a 1% drop rate.
Heres the current code

= public static int Flambeed[] = { 17001, 17014}; public static int randomFlambeed() { return Flambeed[(int) (Math.random() * Flambeed.length)]; }

I want 17014, to have a 1% drop rate, and 17001 to have a 100% drop rate. How do I do so?

Please help and tyvm!
